text: <@U7VHJ9ZFT> pinned a message to this channel.

That's great news, <@U22PNRAJD>. While I understand your reasoning for removing the HTML module in the first place, I also see a lot of use cases that are difficult, if not impossible, to replicate without it. Will the 'revised' HTML module retain the Smart functionality that the old one has? With the user-friendly GUI and all: <http://prntscr.com/i2kx3w> :slightly_smiling_face:

Thanks Chad.
Which cookies must be change ? And how can I succeed to do this ? (javascript ? hubl ?)
<@U2H3TT8F2> not so much a site map but an RSS feed of the website similar to wordpress usually a /feed.xml

Ah ok, yea the link above would show you for just the blog, if you wanted to see a list of COS pages, you could use the List Pages API here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/pages/get_pages>
